intro: [WRONG START] Pulla decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive pullea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often covered in fine, soft hairs. Pullea decipiens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
